title: CMakeFiles/Makefile2:67: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/mnist-app.dir/all' failed
body_html:
🐛 Bug

make

[ 50%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/mnist-app.dir/mnist.cpp.o

Makefile:83: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Following this tutorial: https://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/cpp_export.html

Expected behavior

To compile the .cpp file

Environment

Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 1.0.0.dev20181029
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.5.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: Could not collect
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: Quadro M4000
Nvidia driver version: 390.67
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] pytorch-nightly 1.0.0.dev20181029 py3.6_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.1.2_0 pytorch
[conda] torch 0.4.1
[conda] torchtext 0.2.3
[conda] torchvision 0.2.1

Additional context

cat build/build.sh
export Torch_DIR=../libtorch/share/cmake/Torch
export Caffe2_DIR=../libtorch/share/cmake/Caffe2
#cmake -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=../libtorch/ ..
cmake -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME=Darwin -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR=i386 -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION=10 -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=../libtorch/ ..

Code:

#include <torch/script.h> // One-stop header.

#include <iostream>
#include <memory>

int main(int argc, const char* argv[]) {
  if (argc != 2) {
    std::cerr << "usage: example-app <path-to-exported-script-module>\n";
    return -1;
  }

  // Deserialize the ScriptModule from a file using torch::jit::load().
  std::shared_ptr<torch::jit::script::Module> module = torch::jit::load(argv[1]);

  assert(module != nullptr);
  std::cout << "ok\n";
}

Code:
#include <torch/script.h> // One-stop header.

#include <iostream>
#include <memory>

int main(int argc, const char* argv[]) {
  if (argc != 2) {
    std::cerr << "usage: example-app <path-to-exported-script-module>\n";
    return -1;
  }

  // Deserialize the ScriptModule from a file using torch::jit::load().
  std::shared_ptr<torch::jit::script::Module> module = torch::jit::load(argv[1]);

  assert(module != nullptr);
  std::cout << "ok\n";
}

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Following this tutorial: https://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/cpp_export.html

## Expected behavior

To compile the .cpp file

## Environment

Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 1.0.0.dev20181029
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.5.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: Could not collect
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: Quadro M4000
Nvidia driver version: 390.67
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
/usr/local/cuda-9.1/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] pytorch-nightly           1.0.0.dev20181029 py3.6_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.1.2_0    pytorch
[conda] torch                     0.4.1                     <pip>
[conda] torchtext                 0.2.3                     <pip>
[conda] torchvision               0.2.1                     <pip>

## Additional context

```
cat build/build.sh
export Torch_DIR=../libtorch/share/cmake/Torch
export Caffe2_DIR=../libtorch/share/cmake/Caffe2
#cmake -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=../libtorch/ ..
cmake -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME=Darwin -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR=i386 -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION=10 -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=../libtorch/ ..

```

Code:
```
#include <torch/script.h> // One-stop header.

#include <iostream>
#include <memory>

int main(int argc, const char* argv[]) {
  if (argc != 2) {
    std::cerr << "usage: example-app <path-to-exported-script-module>\n";
    return -1;
  }

  // Deserialize the ScriptModule from a file using torch::jit::load().
  std::shared_ptr<torch::jit::script::Module> module = torch::jit::load(argv[1]);

  assert(module != nullptr);
  std::cout << "ok\n";
}
```
